Functions¶

class my_functions.GB_fragment¶

Bases: object

A class to represent a Golden Braid fragment.

fragment_id¶

The ID of the fragment.

Type:

str

sequence¶

The sequence of the fragment.

Type:

str

backbone¶

The backbone associated with the fragment.

Type:

str

size¶

The size of the fragment.

Type:

int

destination¶

The destination fragment in the assembly.

Type:

GB_fragment

level¶

The level of the fragment which represents the backbone.

Type:

numpy.array

origin¶

The origin fragments of the current fragment.

Type:

list

order¶

The binary order of the fragment.

Type:

list

decimal_order¶

The decimal order of the fragment.

Type:

int

all_basal¶

The list of all basal (child) fragments.

Type:

list

__init__(fragment_id='', sequence='', backbone='', size=0, destination=None, level=array([0, 0]), origin=[], order=[], decimal_order=0, all_basal=None)¶

Initialize a GB_fragment instance.

Parameters:

  • fragment_id (str) – The ID of the fragment.

  • sequence (str) – The sequence of the fragment.

  • backbone (str) – The backbone associated with the fragment.

  • size (int) – The size of the fragment.

  • destination (GB_fragment) – The destination fragment in the assembly.

  • level (numpy.array) – The level of the fragment which represents the backbone.

  • origin (list) – The origin fragments of the current fragment.

  • order (list) – The binary order of the fragment.

  • decimal_order (int) – The decimal order of the fragment.

  • all_basal (list) – The list of all basal (child) fragments.

backpropagation()¶

Propagate level and order information back to origin fragments.

define_backbone()¶

Define the backbone for the fragment based on its level.

Returns:

The level of the fragment.

Return type:

numpy.array

forwardpropagation()¶

Propagate sequence and size information from origin fragments.

start_forwardpropagation()¶

Initiate forward propagation to update destination fragment.

my_functions.assemble(plasmid1, plasmid2)¶

Assemble two plasmids into a new GB_fragment.

Parameters:

  • plasmid1 (GB_fragment) – The first plasmid fragment.

  • plasmid2 (GB_fragment) – The second plasmid fragment.

Returns:

The assembled plasmid fragment.

Return type:

GB_fragment

my_functions.build_tree(combined_ids_list, sequences)¶

Build an assembly tree from combined IDs and sequences.

Parameters:

  • combined_ids_list (list) – List of combined sequence IDs.

  • sequences (list) – List of sequence information dictionaries.

Returns:

A list of DataFrames representing the assembly plan for each final sequence.

Return type:

list

my_functions.calculate_alpha_probability(n)¶

Calculate the probability to have an alpha backbone for a given number of fragments.

Parameters:

n (int) – The number of fragments.

Returns:

The alpha probability.

Return type:

float

my_functions.calculate_tm(primer)¶

Calculate the melting temperature of the primer.

my_functions.convert_binary(initial, initial_set)¶

Convert the binary order of a fragment to a decimal value.

Parameters:

  • initial (GB_fragment) – The fragment to convert.

  • initial_set (list) – The set of initial fragments.

Returns:

The decimal order of the fragment.

Return type:

int

my_functions.design_primers(sequence, optimal_tm=58)¶

Design forward and reverse primers for the given sequence.

my_functions.find_and_concatenate_sequences(sequence_list, max_length, num_sequences)¶

Find and concatenate sequences to form larger sequences with specified constraints. This function creates overlaps between the final assembled sequences. Each overlap is one initial fragment.

Parameters:

  • sequence_list (list) – List of dictionaries containing sequence information.

  • max_length (int) – Maximum allowed length for concatenated sequences.

  • num_sequences (int) – Number of concatenated sequences to generate.

Returns:

A concatenated sequence and a list of lists containing combined sequence IDs.

Return type:

tuple

my_functions.find_primers(sequence, start, end, optimal_tm=58, tm_range=(55, 60), primer_length_range=(15, 20), gc_content_range=(40, 60))¶

Find primers within the specified range and conditions.

my_functions.gc_content(primer)¶

Calculate the GC content of the primer.

my_functions.get_backbones(backbones_paths)¶

Extract backbones from GenBank files.

Parameters:

backbones_paths (list) – List of file paths to GenBank files.

Returns:

A list of GenBank records representing the backbones.

Return type:

list

my_functions.get_domesticated_fragments(domesticated_fragments_paths)¶

Extract domesticated fragments from GenBank files.

Parameters:

domesticated_fragments_paths (list) – List of file paths to GenBank files.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing sequence ID, sequence, and size of each fragment.

Return type:

list

my_functions.process_genbank_files(gb_dir)¶

Process GenBank files and design primers for each sequence.

my_functions.save_to_csv(primer_designs, output_file='primer_designs_outwards.csv')¶

Save the primer designs to a CSV file.

my_functions.save_uploaded_file(file)¶

Save an uploaded file to a temporary location.

Parameters:

file – The uploaded file object.

Returns:

The path to the saved temporary file.

Return type:

str

my_functions.split_if(fragment_id)¶

Split the fragment ID if it contains ‘pUU’.

Parameters:

fragment_id (str) – The fragment ID.

Returns:

The split fragment ID or the original fragment ID.

Return type:

str

app.generate_reports(df, index, domesticated_paths, backbones_paths)¶

Generate an assembly report from a DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The DataFrame containing the assembly data.

  • index (int) – Index of the DataFrame in the list for report naming.

  • domesticated_paths (list of str) – Paths to domesticated fragment files.

  • backbones_paths (list of str) – Paths to backbone files.

Returns:

None

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during the report generation process.

Notes

The function modifies the recognition sites for certain enzymes if ‘omega’ is present in the part name to work around a limitation in the DNA cauldron assembly process.
